alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:02PM CDT until March 31 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND WEST CENTRAL BUREAU COUNTIES... At 402 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near German Corner, or near Kewanee, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... German Corner and Kewanee Municipal Airport around 405 PM CDT. Kewanee around 410 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Annawan, Johnson-Sauk Trail State Park, Neponset, Mineral and Sheffield. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Illinois.
